name: Borderlands
description: There’s no better moment than right now to celebrate the success of the Borderlands Project and brew some of the best coffees from the region. This coffee combines harvest lots from two recently-formed farmer associations and has an impeccable sweetness, bearing notes of dark fruit and brown sugar.

name: Epoch Espresso
description: The yellow honey version adds complexity to the blend with tasting notes of berry and cinnamon. Is it a blend? Yes. Is it a single origin coffee? Yes. Is it delicious? Extremely.

name: Kagumoini
description: This coffee has a bright and juicy acidity and a honey like sweetness. The classic Kenya savoriness is the backdrop to an array of sweet fruits like blackberry, pineapple and orange. The finish is cedar and spicy.

name: Guariroba Peaberry
description: This is a peaberry selection from the farm of Homero Aguiar Paiva, Fazenda Guariroba in Minas Gerais, Brazil. Peaberries are formed when the coffee fruit only produces a single seed instead of the typical two. This results in a higher concentration of sugars and other nutrients in the coffee, making them both delicious and preciously valued.

name: Ecuador Maputo
description: Tasting Notes: Toffee, Lemon, Floral

name: El Tambo
description: In terms of harvesting and process, most all members are harvesting only fully ripe cherries, depulping on the same day as harvest, processing on their own farms, and drying on raised beds inside parabolic dryers. Tasting Notes: Chocolate, Grapefruit, Dried Fruit

The Spring Fling is a lively Madcap blend to celebrate the spring season. It’s full of life and new beginnings with sweet, delicate, and floral flavor.  This is another seasonal blend that carries our intention of stepping outside of the box to create an exotic experience made up of a couple of our finest fresh crop offerings.  It’s the perfect beverage to enjoy while flowers blossom and the birds start chirping.
name: Spring Fling

description: Located in the Nariño Department in southwest Colombia, Galeras is culled from micro-producers outside of the capitol, Pasto. All the farmers who contribute to Galeras grow coffee surrounding the active Volcan de Galeras, where it gleans its name. The climate here is dry and we believe that dryness, in combination with super-high elevations, accounts for the creation of some of the most complex coffees in Colombia.
name: Galeras
Inza
description: Inza, located in Cauca, Southern Colombia produce the type of coffees we get exited about. Big, juicy and sparkly clean. Inza is made up of producers that own tiny plots of land and perform all of the harvesting, processing and drying on their own. Our Inza coffee features farm owners from the area that we have found to produce the refined qualities we love.

name: Kanzu
description: Lush, deeply fruited, and juicy, Kanzu is vivid, clear and clean. This marks our fourth consecutive season purchasing coffee from the Nyamasheke region. This dynamic coffee represents the potential for high-quality in Rwanda, and elsewhere in Africa where excellent terroir can be at odds with challenges in infrastructure and government which make uncovering coffees like Kanzu difficult. We’re very excited to offer this coffee for Winter and Spring. Rich, stone fruit, floral and spice

name: Creamy Seasonal Blend
description: As filter/drip we typically brew at 31-32 g coffee and 500 ml water using Kalita, Hario or similar pourover style. In this method of prep expect a greater presence of dried fruit notes and a range of chocolate flavors.

name: Corsica
description: It’s a coffee you know and love, with deep, dark chocolate tones and a bold coffee flavor. Named for an ancient island in the Mediterranean, Corsica’s cocoa notes pair beautifully with milk or stand alone, making it the perfect filter coffee for a fulfilling morning.

name: El Roble
description: MOLASSES, FUDGE, CHERRY

name: La Palmera
description: NECTARINE, BUTTERSCOTCH, VANILLA, DARK CHOCOLATE

name: Gaaki Aa
description: MANDARIN, BUTTERSCOTCH, GUAVA

name: Ranchos Caldera
description: CACAO, VANILLA, MANGO, WHITECURRANT

name: La Morelia
description: MOLASSES, POMEGRANATE, ROSE

name: Gedeb
description: JASMINE, HONEY, MANDARIN

name: Ephemera
description: The profile is dense and complex. Concord grape notes are punchy and winey right at the first sip. Mulling spices and cinnamon stick come into play as the espresso cools a bit. Molasses sweetness can be tasted throughout the duration of the beverage, and really cuts through milk in a nice way.

name: Kiganda Murambi
description: This lot is very very sweet regardless of brew method. We've brewed pour-over & aeropress with great success, profiling like a fresh honeydew melon and tart lime juice. Brown sugar sweetness dominates the cup as it cools. Pour-over yielded more complexity in terms of spices & a green apple note.

name: Musasa Ruli
description: Expect to taste complex spice notes like clove and coriander right up front. The coffee really sweetens up as it cools, white grape juice & lemonade flavors boldly emerge and mute some of the spice. The sweetness is almost as simple as a raw sugar or brown sugar in its entirety.. which makes for a very delicious single origin espresso option.

name: Bufanda Remera
description: This 100% Red Bourbon lot is quite a stark contrast from the other Red Bourbon Rwanda we have on the menu right now - the sweetness is less immediate while the complexity shines right away. Herbaceous notes (not overwhelming) of sweet basil and marjoram with a nice spiced orange peel/mulling spice complexity can be tasted right off the brew. As it cools you'll taste more meyer lemon, lime, citrus & subtle cinnamon.

name: Ethiopia Agaro Jimma
description: Heirloom varieties make up this lot & give off aromas of mixed berries, agave syrup, red grapes & green tea. As a pour-over the cup is heavy in berry syrup, lemonade acidity and honey flavors. As the cup cools it displays some lovely biscuit and maple syrup notes.

name: Ennaria Limu
description: Tropical fruits dominate this coffee, pineapple & tangerine coming to mind initially. Underlying flavors of black tea & hazelnut (even nutella) emerge as the coffee cools. As an espresso the hazelnut aspect is very forward with subtle spice and citrus highlights.

name: Dona Rosa
description: Densely sweet and fruited flavors emerge as the water hits the ground coffee - there's no mistaking that this is a well processed that was picked perfectly ripe even before tasting it. Brown sugar and ripe red berries are the punchy flavors you'll taste first, followed not far behind by a gentle butteriness & delicate mulled wine spice. Seriously one of the more dominate flavor profiles we have right now - this isn't one to miss out on!

name: Pedra Branca
description: Overall the profile of this coffee is simple & sweet. Almond and cocoa come through at first sip, followed by honey and light fresh berry flavors. Very dense and caramelized  overall but if you brew it just right you'll get some delicious fruited undertones!

name: El Tundo
description: In this exceptional coffee, she's used her discerning palate to identify the perfect combination of product from five farmers who occupy the lush mountain forests near the Peruvian border. A truly exceptional Ecuadorean bean creates a cup of vibrant stone fruit and raw earthy sweetness.

name: El Tundo
description: something about it
